data.meta_description:
Marry up.

This is my amazing wife, Jenny Leanne Cooper. 

We celebrated 24 years of marriage last night!

Jenny and I met the first week on campus at theâ€¦ | 42 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
We all need a break at times. Have you ever taken a break from your phone? I did it! It was easier than I thought it would be. It was better than I thought it would be. I probably needed it more than I thought I did. I took a 9 DAY tech break! I put my phone away - in a closet - for 9 days. I recently switched companies, and I had a week off. The weekend before the week off and the weekend after gave me 9 days. I THOUGHT: â€œI better do this now before I get flooded with customer calls in the new role.â€ Iâ€™m glad I did. HOW I DID IT: 1. I set my out of office settings in email. 2. I changed my voicemail to say that I was away for 9 days. 3. I turned on â€œDo Not Disturb While Drivingâ€ on my iPhone. (I changed the automatic outbound message on that feature to say that I was away from texts until July 15 and would respond then). 4. I cleared my calendar for July 15 because I knew Iâ€™d be catching up on all messages that day - when I returned. 5. I told my immediate family that I wouldnâ€™t have my phone for a week - and to call my wife if they needed me. TAKEAWAYS FROM MY TECH BREAK: 1. I survived! 2. Oddly enough, I did not miss my phone. 3. I was more peaceful that week. 4. I slept better. 5. I Googled less stuff. Itâ€™s amazing to me how often I look up meaningless trivia. I couldnâ€™t do that, so I didnâ€™t. 6. I switched from audio books to actual reading. That was nice. 7. I even drove a few places without my Maps feature. THE RETURN: I came back to around: 250 text messages 120 work emails (some from before I left) 400 personal emails (mostly junk) 15 missed calls (mostly telemarketers) 15 Webex Teams messages 1 Voicemail (thanks, HonorÃ©e Corder - ğŸ˜€) NOW: Iâ€™m caught up! Back to â€œinbox zeroâ€ and nothing unprocessed. IT WAS WORTH IT! â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”- What about you? Have you done a tech break like this? How did it go? Any suggestions? #rest #mentalhealth #deepwork â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” I provide Value Added Resell for all things data center related through Flagler Technologies. If youâ€™re in IT, And you have a need, DM me and letâ€™s chat.

Well, last week was historic! At least in the Cooper family. Last Wednesday, my wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary! The coolest thing happened that night. Our youngest son said that he saw a sign on the downtown Franklin Theater that night that said, â€œ25 Years Later.â€ So, we drove by there before our celebration date night. That night, they happened to be replaying the movie â€œNotting Hillâ€ with Julia Roberts & Hugh Grant. We didnâ€™t stop for the movie, but we did stop to get this picture! We cropped out â€œNotting Hillâ€ and kept the â€œ25 Years Laterâ€ part! I could not be more thankful for my wife! Jenny has been by my side through every up and down and twist and turn in my career. Sheâ€™s celebrated wins and stuck beside me through losses. When the going gets tough, she shines the brightest. Jenny isnâ€™t on LinkedIn, but Iâ€™ll show this to her. Babe, THANK YOU for 25 years!!!!!
